metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5337 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in the read_attribute function inGnuTLS before 3.3.26 and 3.5.x before 3.5.8 allow remote attackers to haveunspecified impact via a crafted OpenPGP certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5337` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.5.6-4ubuntu3
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.5.6-4ubuntu3
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.5.6-4ubuntu3
libgnutls30 - 3.5.6-4ubuntu3
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.5.6-4ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.6-4ubuntu3').
